tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Top-75 Money Winner from 2015 Web.com Tour Regular Season
tourBios.curYearHigh: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 24 starts, one third-place finish, two top-10s, five top-25s and 13 cuts made. Was 59th on the final combined money list...After recording a T40 in the year's first event, the Panama Claro Championship, recorded a T3 the next week at the Colombia Championship. Was in second place after both the second (67) and third rounds (66). Closed with a 69 for his best Tour finish in 26 starts, two shots out of the Patrick Rodgers-Steve Marino playoff...Second top 10 came at The Rex Hospital Open. Made a steady climb up the leaderboard to get to 13 under through 54 holes, just two off Harold Varner III's lead. Carded a final-round 69 that included a costly bogey on No. 16 which dropped him into a tie for sixth with Varner, who shot 71. Improved 15 spots to No. 19 in earnings...Made six cuts in his last 10 Regular Seasons appearances. Best finish of the run was a T16 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship, where he took the first-round lead with a blistering 62 that featured a front nine of 29...Finished the Regular Season 44th on the money list. Was No. 1 in the Bounce Back stat (30.68)...In the Web.com Tour Finals, made one cut (T56 at the Small Business Connection Championship at River Run) and missed the other three.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played 24 Web.com Tour events, making 12 cuts. Had four top-10s and seven top-25s. Finished the Regular Season 46th on the money list...After a T54 in his first-ever Tour event in Bogota, Colombia in Feburary, missed the cut in his next six starts...In June, recorded his first top-10, a T10 at the Cleveland Open, which featured closing rounds of 66-68...Later that month, opened with a 73 at the United Leasing Championship in his native Indiana, then carded three consecutive rounds of 70 on the challenging Victoria National GC to finish T10...Two weeks later at the Utah Championship, carded steady rounds of 68-68-67-67, leading to a then-career-best T7 performance...Things improved even more the following week as he played the first 49 holes of the Albertsons Boise Open bogey-free. Earned a T4 with rounds of 69-66 on the weekend...In the first three Web.com Tour Finals events, recorded a pair of T25s and a T22. Came to the season-ending Web.com Tour Championship 55th in the priority ranking and within reach of a TOUR card. A missed cut resulted in him finishing 63rd in the ranking for a card...Finished 4th in Sand Save Percentage (62.5 percent), eighth in Total Driving and 16th in the All-Around Ranking...Recorded two eagles in the second round of the WinCo Foods Portland Open in August. 

2013: Played 10 tournaments on the Asian Tour. Made two cuts, with his best finish a T22 in the Queen's Cup.

2012: Made the cut in his only PGA TOUR career start, finishing T64 at The McGladrey Classic.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the 2010 Indiana State Open...Named first-team All-Big 10 Conference in 2012.
tourBios.personal: Attended Delta High School in Muncie, Ind...Favorite college team is Indiana University...Top TV show is "Entourage."...Says if he didn't play golf, he'd be an architect.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour in 2015 is T3rd at the Colombia Championship Presented by Claro.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 49th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Web.com Tour.
